result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa Q Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10/9/2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid  during period of probation  or civil judgment. DV surcharge does not apply.
**Restitution set at zero.
Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.  Language applied per the State.

No drugs or alcohol.
No violent contact with sone and cooperate with bureau.  No coroporal punishment of children.
No firearms, weapons.
No new law violations.
Expungement if defendant completes successfully all conditions.

Successfully  complete anger management and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes as needed.
Successfully complete  any other counseling and/or treatment deemed apprpropriate.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment if needed.   Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa Q Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin
with Sarah Zawach (under the student practice rule).  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes as needed.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
    --- if needed.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with son and cooperate with bureau.  
   No corporal punishment of children.    
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* 25 hours of Community Service if not employed. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision 
   fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- dv surcharge does not apply.  
* No new law violations.
* Restitution is set at zero. 
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.  Language applies per the State. 
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not provided by defense counsel).
Expungement if defendant completes successfully completes all conditions. 
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 04.

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor and to COUNT 2:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 40 for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   mld

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense request for an adjournment granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-28-2015 at 8:30 am.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date.  mld

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  All conditions of bail including agency supervised contact, is continued until further orer of the Court.   mld
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.B. (10/17/2009) unless supervised by agency.

ADDRESS INFO for Theresa Q Harris
Current: 4146 N. 102nd St. Apt 12, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 01-30-2015)
Prior: 5146 North 105th Street #12, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Theresa Q Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Theresa Q Harris in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
